Hi Ping,

It is great that you are undertaking this project. Here are some of my
initial thoughts.

- In general, I would do analysis off-line and not during the crawl.

- See if Browser Monkeys will scale for this project. If yes, then you get
you javascript engine, events simulations, dom and all other wonders of a
browser for "free".

- If you decide to fetch two pages for cloaking detection be sure that
fetches are coming from different ip addresses/ranges. Also, be sure that
for "browser" fetches you don't make robots.txt requests. This is a
telltale to spammers that you are bot regardless of the IP address,
user-agent and other http request headers. This kind of dual fetching can
easily be done with Heritrix's proxy setting and probably a beanshell
processor.

- As you already pointed out, dual fetching can be expensive. However,
sampling is probably a good way to go given that spammers are usually
ambitious/greedy. So, fetching a couple of pages per host will probably be
good enough. I recommend slash page plus one other link of it.

- As a part of a wish list, it would be good to check how often webmasters
implement beneficial cloaking (removing session ids, parameters and etc.).
Also, if Flash has been a new spamming medium.

Take care,
i.
